column4: hey guys, have had a problem with getting the 7.10 wired connection working, if anyone could help I'd be really relieved
But have to go in a sec..
what networking card?
whatevers in my laptop
.............not helpful
are you new to ubuntu?
sorry :) I'm just checking
I have an asus a3 series, no idea about the card
in the terminal, lspci | grep Network
not printing.
try just "lspci" and look for a Network Controller
02:00.0 Ethernet controller: Atheros Communications, Inc. Unknown device 001c (rev 01)
so does the machine have internet access right now?
Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL-8139/8139C/8139 device 001c
sudo update-pciids
hey there are several other ethernet adapters listed.. No I had to reinstall 7.04 :(
is there a reason you're not using 7.10?
k
sorry I haven't been that clear
so how are you pasting stuff right now?
ok I have updated the pciids and no it lists 2 ethernet adapters:  realtek and atheros
right but can you paste the atheros line again?
